title: minerjones
author: minerjones
created_time: July 16, 2022, 11:44:50 PMLast edit: May 21, 2023, 12:02:26 PM by minerjones
content: From company CARDSMITHS comes their newest line of physical trading cards:CURRENCY Series 1From website:CURRENCY takes the collector on a journey from the earliest days of civilization where mankind first bought, sold, and bartered for the basic goods they needed to survive, to the present where technology, digital banking and cryptocurrencies power the economic engine of commerce. Our Series 1 trading cards depict influential persons, memes, artifacts, and forms of money that have played an important role in the development of civilization and our modern economy.  To bring this unique set to life CARDSMITHS collaborated with some of the top artists in the world of trading cards, comic books, digital illustration, indy art and graphic design. Whether you are a fan of history, finance or just great art pieces, there is something for everyone to treasure with CURRENCY.  The fun doesn’t stop there!  Along with rare foil variants, such as our proprietary Gemstone Refractors™, we have randomly inserted redemption codes into Series 1 packs that award fortunate finders with various amounts of cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, and Dogecoin. Some of the codes are even redeemable for an entire Bitcoin!  Don’t let history pass you by. Start building your CURRENCY Series 1 trading card collection today! Approximate odds of finding per pack: Base Card Parallels: Holofoil 1:1, Crystal Sparkle 1:2, Gemstone Refractor™ 1:10, Cryptocurrency Redemption Code 1:96, Meta-Rare Refractor™ 1:124.From company contact:We’ve created a trading card set, mainly about the history of money and economics, but with a heavy lean into cryptocurrencies.  There are even redemption cards for actual cryptocurrency including multiple redemptions for 1 BTC (more than 5 in total) and 1 ETH (more than 20 in total)   There are also hundreds of redemptions for smaller denoms like 0.1 ETCH, 0.01 BTC, 1 LTC and 5k Doge.  There’s 1 Redemption Card per case and there are 48, 2-Pack Boxes per case. Each 2-Pack box retails for $30.  In theory, you could spend $30 on a 2-pack and pull a redemption card for a $20k 1 BTC.  The odds are quite good as the production run was not big at all.  Much better than say the 1 in a million chance with the Burger King giveaway.The art in the set is fantastic as well.  We commissioned artists who have worked for Marvel, DC, TOPPS, IDW, etc.  There are Bitcoin cards, Satoshi cards, and a bunch of other fun ones.  There’s even an Elon Musk card created by the lead Garbage Pail Kids artist which everyone loves.Also, redemptions are sent to winners through custom Cardsmiths Ballet wallets!!Sales will begin later this week via the website here: https://cardsmiths.com/products/currency-series-1-trading-cards-collector-boxUS customers can order via the website.International customers can also order via the website, but I am offering a group order to help with shipping fees.So if interested, just let me know here or via PM and we will make the order later in the week or next.

comments.author: Crytocanuk
comments.body: Very cool. I’d definitely be in for some!!

comments.body: Would be in for a few!

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Ill take 3- 2 pack boxes for $90I guess the real question is do you open the packs or not?

comments.body: Quote from: cygan on July 17, 2022, 09:32:45 AMdo they work with Ballet wallet or why is the back side of Ballet shown?If you pull a cryptocurrency redemption card, the prize will be sent to you on a custom Cardsmith Ballet wallet Interest List:Crytocanuk - someJambo USA - a few Cryptogreatdane - 3xAmax16 - a few

comments.body: Quote from: cygan on July 17, 2022, 10:30:43 AMQuote from: minerjones on July 17, 2022, 10:29:17 AMQuote from: cygan on July 17, 2022, 09:32:45 AMdo they work with Ballet wallet or why is the back side of Ballet shown?If you pull a cryptocurrency redemption card, the prize will be sent to you on a custom Cardsmith Ballet wallet okay, i see.can you order these redemption cards separately somewhere?No, you have to pull one from a pack of cards

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Quote from: haloxon on July 17, 2022, 01:39:58 PMway too complicated  Find card, fill out form, mail in card. Seems reasonable

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: You know what i like about these. The redemption cards will encourage people to open the packs. Unopened packs will become valuable and rare fairley quickly. The cards themselves will become collectors items.

comments.author: markinaz
comments.body: Very cool, I just ordered a dozen, can't wait to get them!  I figured I will open half and save the others.

comments.author: mortare
comments.created_time: July 17, 2022, 07:35:01 PMLast edit: July 17, 2022, 09:42:58 PM by mortare
comments.body: Im up for 2x 2 pack boxes Make that a 12 x 2 Collector Boxes

comments.author: JUPITYR
comments.body: Jumping in here as I helped to put this project together.The higher denom redemption amounts like 1 BTC, 1 ETH, 5k DOGE and 0.1 BTC will be the standard (non-customized) Ballet Metal cards due to their higher value.  That was a stipulation that Ballet had as they didn't want any super-high values on the custom, plastic cards.The Cardsmiths Ballet cards will be for the 1 LTC, 0.01 BTC, 0.001 BTC and 0.1 ETH denominations.I can also say that this was a relatively low production relative to many modern card sets.  So the odds of finding a higher denom redemption card are very reasonable.  Hopefully you will come for the crypto, but stay for the art.  It's a very vibrant and unique art set.  Like him or not, the Elon card should be popular.  Especially the serial-numbered Gemstone Refractors. That card was drawn by leading Garbage Pail Kids artist Joe Simko.  Seems to be everyone's fav from the set.J

That card was drawn by leading Garbage Pail Kids artist Joe Simko.  Seems to be everyone's fav from the set.JThere one little detail am Still Confuse ,  The complete set !! How many Cards to Collect . I could't find that INFO at site

comments.author: JUPITYR
comments.body: The checklist should be posted on the site today. There are 60 base cards or 62 if you could the alternate art cards.  There are 12 Meta-Rare Refractors and 7 Gemstone Refractor colors with serial-numbering starting at 1 of 149 Orange Beryl and go all the way down to 1 of 1 Black Onyx.  J
